D
THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA
CHAPEL HILL
THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA COMPRISES: THE UNIVERSITY IN CHAPEL HILL, STATE COLLEGE IN RALEIGH, AND THE WOMAN’S COLLEGE IN GREENSBORO
October 17, 1952
ROBERT BURTON HOUSE, Chancellor
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Treasurer
Office of Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
You asked me to give you my estimate of the ability of
Professor Earl Wynn.
Mr. Wynn developed both our Radio Department and our
Communication Center. They are growing, vital segments
of the University because Earl Wynn has been such a very
capable Chairman of the Department and Director of the
Center. He is most enthusiastic about the educational
value of radio and television and advocates their use as
instruments of teaching. A man of his vision would see,
of course, the tremendous opportunities here, and he is
eager to meet the challenge.
Earl Wynn has built a fine Department and Center here, a task
that would have been impossible to a man without outstanding
administrative ability and qualities of leadership. Personally,
he is out-going, refined, nice looking, has a magnificent voice,
and likes people. He, in turn, has many friends in the Uni¬
versity and the community.
If you interest Mr. Wynn in your Executive Directorship you
will get an excellent man, and, quite frankly, we will do our
best to keep him.
Chancellor
